3 bed detached house for sale

East Quantoxhead, Bridgwater TA5

Â£505,000

Property details

  • 3 bedrooms
  • 2 bathrooms
  • 3 reception rooms

Features

  • Attractive detached house
  • Set in approx 1 acre of mature gardens
  • Beautiful views of the quantocks
  • 2 detached garages
  • 3 double bedroom & 2 bathrooms
  • In need of some modernisation

Listing view statistics

Last 30 days: 218 page views

Since listed: 218 page views

Description

Substantial and attractive detached house set in an acre of wonderful landscaped gardens with views of the Quantocks, 2 detached garages and all situated in a beautiful unspoilt Quantock village.

The accommodation benefits from oil fired central heating and comprises, on the ground floor - entrance hall, sitting room with woodburner, conservatory. Dining room, kitchen with Rayburn, utility room, cloakroom and rear porch. On the first floor there are 3 double bedrooms, a bathroom and a shower room.

Externally the property is accessed via a sweeping tarmac driveway with turning circle in front of the house. There are 2 detached garages, one at the entrance of the driveway and one next to the house. The gardens surround the house and extend to around 1 acre in total with a fantastic array of mature trees, shrubs and borders as well as a Wendy House and 2 garden sheds. Wonderful views of the Quantocks and surrounding countryside can be enjoyed from most area of the garden and the property and grounds benefit from being totally private.

East Quantoxhead is a small village approx. 1 mile outside of Kilve, lying just off the Main A39 and on the edge of the Bristol channel. The village centre has a feeling of great tranquillity with itâs exquisite manor house, thatched cottages, medieval barns, itâs own duck pond and old mill building. There is a church, village hall and many splendid walks to the beach and around the surrounding countryside. Kilve (1 mile) has a pub, village hall and post office/village stores. Williton (4.5 miles) has a range of day to day amenities including Co-op, Spar, Lloyds Bank, Post Office, Cottage Hospital, pharmacy, several cafes/restaurants and a range of independent local businesses. Bridgwater (13 miles) provides access to the national motorway system.
View more View less

Water costs explained

Water consumption is based on average water usage for the predicted occupancy of the property based on the number of bedrooms.
Total annual consumption (in cubic meters) is then averaged into a monthly cost.
Note: If you have 2 separate suppliers for water and sewage, you may receive 2 separate bills.

Estimated cost

Â£268 per month

When paid over 10 months

The breakdown

  • Council tax band G Â£268 per month

    West Somerset

Council tax explained

The Council Tax cost displayed is based on the council tax band and on the basis of 2 adults living at the property. The monthly cost shown excludes any discounts and is rounded to the nearest pound.
Full information on Council Tax discount entitlements can be found on the Gov.UK's website.
